tools.detailed_description: An open-source application built on the MOOSE framework for simulating plasma physics. It leverages MOOSE's finite element capabilities to solve the drift-diffusion and other plasma-related equations.

tools.name: pyOpenFOAM
tools.one_line_profile: Python-based Finite Volume Method CFD library
tools.detailed_description: A Python library implementing the Finite Volume Method (FVM) for Computational Fluid Dynamics (CFD). It is designed to simulate fluid flow and heat transfer, following the principles of OpenFOAM and standard FVM textbooks.

tools.name: SOFA
tools.one_line_profile: Real-time multi-physics simulation framework
tools.detailed_description: An open-source framework primarily for real-time medical simulation, supporting multi-physics simulation (mechanics, thermodynamics, electrophysiology). It uses various numerical methods including FEM and mass-spring systems for interactive simulations.

tools.name: MORFEUS
tools.one_line_profile: Multi-physics Object-oriented Reconfigurable Fluid Environment
tools.detailed_description: A simulation framework for multi-physics problems, focusing on fluid dynamics. It provides an object-oriented environment for unified simulations, likely supporting various discretization methods for fluid flow.

tools.name: shenfun
tools.one_line_profile: High performance spectral Galerkin method platform in Python
tools.detailed_description: A Python platform for solving partial differential equations (PDEs) using the spectral Galerkin method. It automates the creation of matrices and vectors for spectral methods and supports high-performance computing via MPI.

tools.name: Spirit
tools.one_line_profile: Atomistic Spin Simulation Framework
tools.detailed_description: A cross-platform framework for atomistic spin simulations. It allows for the simulation of magnetic systems using various methods, including Landau-Lifshitz-Gilbert dynamics and Monte Carlo methods, with real-time visualization capabilities.

tools.name: dem-fem-coupling
tools.one_line_profile: Coupling of Finite Element Method and Discrete Element Method
tools.detailed_description: Open source codes for coupling Finite Element Method (FEM) and Discrete Element Method (DEM) simulations. It bridges the YADE (DEM) and OOFEM (FEM) software packages to enable multi-scale or multi-physics simulations involving granular materials and structures.

tools.name: HelFEM
tools.one_line_profile: Finite element methods for electronic structure calculations
tools.detailed_description: A software package implementing finite element methods for electronic structure calculations on small systems. It applies high-order finite elements to solve the Schrödinger equation for atoms and molecules.

tools.name: eom
tools.one_line_profile: Configurable ODE/PDE solver in Rust
tools.detailed_description: A Rust library providing explicit and semi-implicit numerical schemes for solving ordinary and partial differential equations, designed for high performance and configurability.

tools.name: Multiphysics
tools.one_line_profile: DG-FEM solver for hyperbolic systems (Shallow Water Equations)
tools.detailed_description: A Discontinuous Galerkin Finite Element Method (DG-FEM) solver using Runge-Kutta time stepping, specifically optimized for hyperbolic systems like shallow water equations.

tools.name: Neural-Solver-Library
tools.one_line_profile: Library for Advanced Neural PDE Solvers
tools.detailed_description: A comprehensive library implementing various neural network-based methods for solving Partial Differential Equations (PDEs), serving as a foundation for AI4Science research.

tools.name: GDS3D
tools.one_line_profile: 3D renderer for IC layout GDSII files
tools.detailed_description: A visualization tool that interprets GDSII integrated circuit layout files and renders them in 3D, allowing for real-time inspection of semiconductor process structures.

tools.name: PhiFlow
tools.one_line_profile: Differentiable PDE solving framework for machine learning
tools.detailed_description: A differentiable simulation framework for fluid dynamics and other physical systems, designed to integrate seamlessly with machine learning frameworks like PyTorch, TensorFlow, and JAX.

tools.name: turbinesFoam
tools.one_line_profile: Actuator line modeling extension for OpenFOAM
tools.detailed_description: A library extension for OpenFOAM that implements actuator line modeling, specifically designed for simulating wind and tidal turbines within CFD environments.

tools.name: jaxdf
tools.one_line_profile: JAX-based framework for differentiable numerical simulators
tools.detailed_description: A research framework built on JAX for creating differentiable numerical simulators with arbitrary discretizations, facilitating gradient-based optimization in physical simulations.

tools.name: hybridCentralSolvers
tools.one_line_profile: Collection of hybrid central solvers for OpenFOAM
tools.detailed_description: A suite of solvers for OpenFOAM implementing hybrid central schemes for compressible flows, supporting one-phase, two-phase, and multicomponent systems.

tools.name: libAcoustics
tools.one_line_profile: OpenFOAM library for far-field noise computation
tools.detailed_description: An OpenFOAM library dedicated to computing far-field noise from CFD simulations using acoustic analogies (e.g., Ffowcs Williams-Hawkings).

tools.name: FiPy
tools.one_line_profile: Finite Volume PDE solver in Python
tools.detailed_description: An object-oriented Partial Differential Equation (PDE) solver, written in Python, based on a standard finite volume (FV) approach. It is designed for solving coupled sets of PDEs.

tools.name: DRLinFluids
tools.one_line_profile: Platform coupling Deep Reinforcement Learning and OpenFOAM
tools.detailed_description: An open-source platform that integrates Deep Reinforcement Learning (DRL) algorithms with OpenFOAM for flow control and optimization problems in fluid dynamics.

tools.name: fealpy
tools.one_line_profile: Finite Element Analysis Library in Python
tools.detailed_description: A Python library for finite element analysis, providing data structures and algorithms for mesh generation, assembly, and solving of PDEs using FEM.

tools.name: drdg3d
tools.one_line_profile: DG-FEM code for 3D dynamic rupture modeling
tools.detailed_description: A Discontinuous Galerkin Finite Element Method code specifically designed for simulating 3D dynamic rupture processes in seismology and geophysics.

tools.name: ofpp
tools.one_line_profile: OpenFOAM Python Parser
tools.detailed_description: A Python library to parse OpenFOAM output files directly into Numpy arrays, facilitating data analysis and post-processing of CFD results in Python.

tools.name: wan
tools.one_line_profile: Deep learning-based solver for high-dimensional PDEs using Weak Adversarial Networks
tools.detailed_description: A Python implementation of the Weak Adversarial Network (WAN) method for solving high-dimensional partial differential equations based on their weak formulation.

tools.name: DGseisfor3D
tools.one_line_profile: 3D seismic wave simulation solver based on the Discontinuous Galerkin Method
tools.detailed_description: A Fortran-based solver for 3D simulation of seismic waves utilizing the Discontinuous Galerkin (DG) method, suitable for geophysics and wave propagation studies.

tools.name: NonLinPDEs-GPsolver
tools.one_line_profile: Solver for nonlinear PDEs using Gaussian Processes
tools.detailed_description: Code implementation for solving and learning nonlinear partial differential equations using Gaussian Processes, enabling probabilistic inference for PDE parameters and solutions.

tools.name: Futureye_JIT
tools.one_line_profile: Java-based Finite Element Method (FEM) library for solving PDE forward and inverse problems
tools.detailed_description: A Java FEM library designed for efficiency comparable to Fortran, supporting the solution of PDE-based forward and inverse problems.

tools.name: Multiscale-FEM
tools.one_line_profile: MATLAB implementation of the Multiscale Finite Element Method (MsFEM)
tools.detailed_description: A MATLAB codebase implementing the Multiscale Finite Element Method, useful for solving PDEs with multiscale features in materials science and physics.

tools.name: dugksFoam
tools.one_line_profile: OpenFOAM solver for Boltzmann model equations using the Discrete Unified Gas Kinetic Scheme
tools.detailed_description: An OpenFOAM-based solver implementing the Discrete Unified Gas Kinetic Scheme (DUGKS) for simulating Boltzmann model equations, applicable to rarefied gas dynamics.

tools.name: GridapTopOpt.jl
tools.one_line_profile: Computational toolbox for level set-based topology optimization in Julia
tools.detailed_description: A Julia toolbox built on the Gridap ecosystem for performing level set-based topology optimization, facilitating structural design and analysis.

tools.name: py-pde
tools.one_line_profile: Python package for solving partial differential equations using finite difference methods
tools.detailed_description: A comprehensive Python package for solving partial differential equations (PDEs) on grids using finite difference methods, supporting various boundary conditions and differential operators.

tools.name: hexed
tools.one_line_profile: Discontinuous Galerkin CFD solver with automated meshing
tools.detailed_description: A computational fluid dynamics solver based on the discontinuous Galerkin method. It features automated, unstructured quadrilateral/hexahedral meshing capabilities to streamline the simulation workflow.

tools.name: coral
tools.one_line_profile: Parallel spectral solver for PDEs in plane layer geometry
tools.detailed_description: A Fortran-based parallel spectral solver designed for solving partial differential equations in plane layer geometries, suitable for fluid dynamics and other physics simulations requiring high-accuracy spectral discretizations.

tools.name: Eigentools
tools.one_line_profile: Eigenvalue problem analysis package for Dedalus
tools.detailed_description: An extension package for the Dedalus framework specifically designed to solve and analyze eigenvalue problems, facilitating stability analysis and modal decomposition in fluid dynamics and other fields.

tools.name: pySEMTools
tools.one_line_profile: Post-processing package for Spectral Element Method data
tools.detailed_description: A Python package designed for post-processing and analyzing data generated by Spectral Element Method (SEM) simulations, likely supporting formats from solvers like Nek5000.

tools.name: Basix
tools.one_line_profile: Finite element basis evaluation library for FEniCSx
tools.detailed_description: A library that provides evaluation of finite element basis functions. It is a core component of the FEniCSx project, handling the tabulation of elements for various cell types and polynomial orders.

tools.name: SELF
tools.one_line_profile: Spectral Element Library in Fortran
tools.detailed_description: A Fortran library implementing the Spectral Element Method for solving conservation laws. It is designed for high-performance computing and supports GPU acceleration for fluid dynamics and other physics.

tools.name: SpectralLDA-TensorSpark
tools.one_line_profile: Spectral learning method for LDA topic models on Spark
tools.detailed_description: An implementation of spectral methods (third-order tensor decomposition) for learning Latent Dirichlet Allocation (LDA) topic models, scaled using Apache Spark. It applies spectral algorithms to large-scale data analysis.

tools.name: Quail
tools.one_line_profile: Lightweight Discontinuous Galerkin solver for prototyping
tools.detailed_description: A Python-based Discontinuous Galerkin (DG) solver designed for teaching, prototyping, and testing new numerical schemes. It provides a flexible environment for experimenting with DG methods.

tools.name: FastTransforms.jl
tools.one_line_profile: Orthogonal polynomial transforms library for Julia
tools.detailed_description: A Julia package for performing fast orthogonal polynomial transforms. It supports various polynomial bases (Chebyshev, Legendre, etc.) and is essential for spectral methods and approximation theory.

tools.name: Adaptive Multiresolution DG
tools.one_line_profile: Adaptive multiresolution Discontinuous Galerkin package
tools.detailed_description: A C++ package implementing adaptive multiresolution techniques for the Discontinuous Galerkin method, enabling efficient high-order simulations with local mesh refinement.

tools.name: KTH_Framework
tools.one_line_profile: Toolbox framework for Nek5000
tools.detailed_description: A framework for managing and integrating various toolboxes and extensions developed for the Nek5000 spectral element solver, facilitating workflow management and code reuse within the KTH-Nek5000 ecosystem.

tools.name: FastTransforms
tools.one_line_profile: C library for fast orthogonal polynomial transforms
tools.detailed_description: A C library providing fast algorithms for orthogonal polynomial transforms, serving as a backend for high-performance spectral methods and approximation tasks.

tools.name: Nek5000
tools.one_line_profile: High-fidelity spectral element CFD solver
tools.detailed_description: A highly scalable computational fluid dynamics solver based on the spectral element method. It is designed for high-fidelity simulation of turbulent flows and supports massive parallelism on supercomputers.

tools.name: NekROM
tools.one_line_profile: Model-Order Reduction Framework for Nek5000
tools.detailed_description: A framework integrated with Nek5000 for performing Model-Order Reduction (ROM). It allows for the creation of reduced-order models from high-fidelity spectral element simulations to accelerate analysis and control tasks.

tools.name: NekCEM
tools.one_line_profile: Spectral-element solver for Maxwell's and drift-diffusion equations
tools.detailed_description: A spectral element solver specialized for computational electromagnetics (Maxwell's equations) and drift-diffusion equations. It leverages the high-order accuracy of spectral methods for electromagnetic simulations.

tools.name: hp3d
tools.one_line_profile: hp-adaptive 3D finite element software
tools.detailed_description: A 3D finite element software package supporting hp-adaptivity (simultaneous mesh refinement and polynomial order increase). It is designed for high-accuracy simulations requiring dynamic resolution adjustment.

tools.name: OpenSEMBA/dgtd
tools.one_line_profile: Discontinuous Galerkin Time Domain solver for Maxwell's equations
tools.detailed_description: A solver for Maxwell's curl equations utilizing discontinuous Galerkin methods (DGTD), suitable for computational electromagnetics simulations.

tools.name: BasisMatrices.jl
tools.one_line_profile: Julia library for constructing functional basis matrices
tools.detailed_description: A Julia package providing routines to construct BasisMatrices of various types including Chebyshev polynomials, B-Splines, and Smolyak grids, useful for spectral methods and function approximation.

tools.name: ChebyshevApprox.jl
tools.one_line_profile: Multivariate function approximation using Chebyshev polynomials
tools.detailed_description: A Julia package designed to approximate multivariate continuous functions using Chebyshev polynomials, supporting spectral approximation tasks.

tools.name: ChebyKAN
tools.one_line_profile: Kolmogorov-Arnold Networks implementation using Chebyshev polynomials
tools.detailed_description: An implementation of Kolmogorov-Arnold Networks (KAN) that utilizes Chebyshev polynomials as basis functions instead of B-splines, offering a spectral approach to neural network function approximation.

tools.name: pySED
tools.one_line_profile: Phonon spectral energy density calculation tool
tools.detailed_description: A tool to implement the phonon Spectral Energy Density (SED) method for calculating phonon lifetimes and thermal properties in materials science.

tools.name: apollo
tools.one_line_profile: MOOSE-based application for 3D electromagnetics simulation
tools.detailed_description: An application enabling 3D electromagnetics simulation within the MOOSE framework, leveraging the MFEM finite element library for underlying computations.

tools.name: Palace
tools.one_line_profile: High-performance 3D computational electromagnetics solver
tools.detailed_description: A parallel, high-performance 3D finite element solver for computational electromagnetics, developed at AWS Labs, supporting large-scale simulations.

tools.name: Chebfun
tools.one_line_profile: Numerical computing with functions in MATLAB
tools.detailed_description: An open-source software system for numerical computing with functions, using Chebyshev polynomials and spectral methods to perform operations like differentiation, integration, and root-finding with high accuracy.

tools.name: chebpy
tools.one_line_profile: Python implementation of Chebfun
tools.detailed_description: A Python implementation of the Chebfun project, enabling numerical computing with functions using Chebyshev polynomial expansions in a Python environment.

tools.name: ryujin
tools.one_line_profile: High-performance high-order finite element solver for hyperbolic conservation equations
tools.detailed_description: Ryujin is a high-performance, high-order finite element solver specifically designed for hyperbolic conservation equations. It leverages convex limiting techniques to ensure stability and accuracy in numerical simulations.

tools.name: Spectral_li-ion_SPM
tools.one_line_profile: Spectral numerical solver for Lithium-ion battery Single Particle Model
tools.detailed_description: This tool provides a MATLAB implementation for solving the Single Particle Model (SPM) of lithium-ion batteries using spectral numerical methods, enabling efficient simulation of battery dynamics.

tools.name: dedalus-sdk-python
tools.one_line_profile: Official Python SDK for the Dedalus spectral method framework
tools.detailed_description: This is the official Python SDK for Dedalus, a flexible framework for solving partial differential equations using spectral methods. It allows users to define and solve PDEs with high accuracy and performance.

tools.name: dedalus-sdk-typescript
tools.one_line_profile: Official TypeScript SDK for the Dedalus API
tools.detailed_description: The TypeScript SDK for Dedalus enables integration of the Dedalus spectral solver framework into web-based applications or TypeScript environments, facilitating remote simulation control or data interaction.

tools.name: PyTorch-Spectral-clustering

tools.detailed_description: A PyTorch implementation of various spectral clustering and dimensionality reduction methods. It leverages GPU acceleration for efficient processing of large datasets in scientific data analysis.

tools.name: pymech

tools.detailed_description: pymech is a Python library designed to assist with the pre- and post-processing of data for the Nek5000 (spectral element) and SIMSON (spectral) CFD codes. It provides tools for reading, writing, and manipulating field files.

tools.name: ENRICO
tools.one_line_profile: Exascale Nuclear Reactor Investigative COde
tools.detailed_description: ENRICO is a high-performance simulation code designed for nuclear reactor investigation at the exascale. It likely couples Monte Carlo transport with thermal-hydraulics or other physics.

tools.name: BinauralSDM

tools.detailed_description: BinauralSDM is a set of tools for rendering Binaural Room Impulse Responses (BRIR) using the Spatial Decomposition Method (SDM). It includes improvements for direction of arrival estimation and spectral properties of rendered audio.

tools.name: Feel++
tools.one_line_profile: Finite Element Embedded Language and Library in C++
tools.detailed_description: Feel++ is a C++ library for solving partial differential equations using the finite element method. It provides a domain-specific language embedded in C++ to express variational formulations and solve complex physics problems.

tools.name: sparselizard
tools.one_line_profile: High-performance C++ finite element library with hp-adaptivity for multi-physics
tools.detailed_description: A fast, user-friendly, and multiphysics C++ finite element library that supports hp-adaptivity (high-order elements) and is designed for high-performance computing applications.

tools.name: hermes-legacy
tools.one_line_profile: C++ library for hp-adaptive finite element methods
tools.detailed_description: A C++ library implementing hp-FEM (adaptive finite element methods with variable element size and polynomial degree) for solving partial differential equations.

tools.name: marlin
tools.one_line_profile: Spectral solver capability for the MOOSE simulation framework
tools.detailed_description: A code that adds spectral solver capabilities to the MOOSE ecosystem, operating on regular orthogonal grids and supporting GPU acceleration for representative volume elements.

tools.name: grudge

tools.detailed_description: A Python-based environment for Discontinuous Galerkin methods, part of the 'inducer' scientific computing ecosystem (UIUC), serving as a successor to 'hedge'.

tools.name: NodesAndModes.jl

tools.detailed_description: A Julia package providing nodes and modes (basis functions) for high-order finite element methods, supporting various element shapes and nodal distributions.

tools.detailed_description: A PyTorch library implementing high-order and sparse layers using Lagrange polynomials, Chebyshev nodes, and Fourier series, enabling spectral methods within deep learning models.

tools.detailed_description: A Julia library dedicated to the efficient calculation of Associated Legendre polynomials, which are fundamental basis functions for spectral methods on spheres.

tools.name: mesh_segmentation

tools.detailed_description: A Python addon for Blender that performs mesh segmentation using spectral clustering methods, enabling scientific visualization and processing of 3D mesh data.

tools.name: FLife

tools.name: NSC

tools.detailed_description: A Python implementation of Nyström-based spectral clustering with K-nearest neighbour-based sampling, specifically designed for individual tree segmentation from airborne LiDAR point cloud data.

tools.detailed_description: A crystal plasticity finite element method (FEM) code designed to run on GPUs, developed by Lawrence Livermore National Laboratory for materials science simulations.

tools.detailed_description: A scalable Reduced Order Model (ROM) implementation utilizing Discontinuous Galerkin (DG) Domain Decomposition, developed by LLNL for efficient large-scale simulations.

tools.detailed_description: MATLAB routines for calculating Radar Cross Section (RCS) using Discontinuous Galerkin Time Domain (DGTD) methods, supporting high-order elements.

tools.detailed_description: A high-order discontinuous Galerkin solver designed for flow simulations and multi-physics applications, emphasizing spectral element methods.

tools.detailed_description: A library extending deal.II with Isogeometric Analysis (IGA) capabilities, developed by the SISSA mathLab.

tools.detailed_description: A library for Real Time Highly Advanced Computational Applications using Spectral Element Methods, focusing on Reduced Order Modeling (ROM).

tools.detailed_description: A toolkit library providing additional functionality and utilities for the deal.II finite element library, developed by SISSA mathLab.

tools.detailed_description: A parallel multiphysics solver built on top of the deal.II library, designed for complex coupled simulations.

tools.name: MFEM

tools.detailed_description: A lightweight, general, and scalable C++ library for finite element methods, supporting high-order finite elements and a wide variety of solvers.

tools.name: Chebyshev

tools.detailed_description: A Python module for approximating SymPy expressions using Taylor series and Chebyshev polynomials, useful for numerical analysis and spectral methods.

tools.name: mpopt

tools.detailed_description: A solver for multi-phase optimal control problems using pseudo-spectral collocation methods.

tools.name: libparanumal

tools.detailed_description: A library of high-performance, GPU-accelerated finite element flow solvers and benchmarks, focusing on high-order methods.

tools.detailed_description: A high-performance magnetohydrodynamics (MHD) solver implementing spectral difference method (SDM) high order schemes, utilizing MPI and Kokkos for parallel execution.

tools.name: pychebfun

tools.detailed_description: A Python library implementing the Chebfun system, allowing for numerical computing with functions using Chebyshev polynomial expansions.

tools.name: TorchFSM

tools.name: PolynomialBases.jl

tools.detailed_description: A Julia library providing efficient implementations of polynomial bases used in spectral element methods, serving as a foundational component for high-order solvers.

tools.name: PostMesh

tools.detailed_description: A library for generating high-order curvilinear meshes, essential for high-order finite element and spectral element analysis.

tools.name: Jexpresso

tools.name: snek5000

tools.name: spectralDNS

tools.detailed_description: A suite of spectral solvers for the Navier-Stokes equations and related systems, implemented in Python.

tools.name: mfem-mgis
tools.one_line_profile: Coupling interface between MFEM and MGIS
tools.detailed_description: A coupling tool that connects the MFEM finite element library with MGIS (MFront Generic Interface Support) for advanced material modelling. (Included due to institutional backing by MFront/EDF ecosystem)

tools.name: FastAST
tools.one_line_profile: Fast primal-dual interior point method for line spectral estimation
tools.detailed_description: A MATLAB implementation of a fast primal-dual interior point method for line spectral estimation via atomic norm soft thresholding.

tools.name: Latent-Spectral-Models

tools.detailed_description: A Python implementation of Latent Spectral Models (LSM) for solving high-dimensional partial differential equations. It leverages spectral methods within a latent space to approximate PDE solutions efficiently, as presented at ICML 2023.

tools.name: SpectralKit.jl
tools.one_line_profile: Julia library for spectral method building blocks
tools.detailed_description: A Julia package providing essential components for implementing spectral methods, including basis functions, transforms, and grid utilities, designed to facilitate the construction of spectral solvers.

tools.name: Trixi.jl

tools.detailed_description: A numerical simulation framework in Julia for hyperbolic conservation laws. It supports adaptive mesh refinement and high-order methods, including Discontinuous Galerkin (DG), making it suitable for fluid dynamics and other physics simulations.

tools.name: python-modularity-maximization
tools.one_line_profile: Spectral method implementation for network modularity maximization
tools.detailed_description: A Python library implementing Newman's spectral method for maximizing modularity in network analysis. It is used for community detection and graph clustering tasks in scientific data analysis.

tools.name: GAS
tools.one_line_profile: Generalized Adversarial Solver for improving discretization of diffusion ODEs
tools.detailed_description: Official implementation of the Generalized Adversarial Solver (GAS) method, designed to improve the discretization quality of Ordinary Differential Equations (ODEs) within diffusion models.

tools.name: jaxkineticmodel
tools.one_line_profile: Systems biology modeling and simulation library using JAX/Diffrax
tools.detailed_description: A library for building, simulating, and training kinetic models in systems biology, leveraging the JAX ecosystem and Diffrax for efficient differential equation solving.

tools.name: eqsolver
tools.one_line_profile: Rust library for numerical equation solving and integration
tools.detailed_description: A Rust library designed for numerical analysis tasks, including equation solving, optimization, and numerical integration, suitable for scientific computing applications.

tools.name: EPD
tools.one_line_profile: Parallel gradient distillation for fast ODE solvers in diffusion models
tools.detailed_description: Implementation of the EPD method (Distilling Parallel Gradients) to accelerate ODE solvers for diffusion models, presented at ICCV 2025.

tools.name: ode
tools.one_line_profile: Ordinary differential equation solving library in Go
tools.detailed_description: A library for solving ordinary differential equations (ODEs) implemented in the Go programming language, providing standard numerical methods.

tools.name: FATODE
tools.one_line_profile: Fortran library for ODE integration with sensitivity analysis
tools.detailed_description: A Fortran library for the integration of ordinary differential equations (ODEs) capable of performing direct and adjoint sensitivity analysis, developed by the Computational Science Laboratory.

tools.name: Integreat
tools.one_line_profile: Mathematica paclet for analyzing numerical integration methods
tools.detailed_description: A Mathematica paclet designed for deriving and analyzing Runge–Kutta, linear multistep, and general linear methods for numerical integration.

tools.name: Arrhenius.jl
tools.one_line_profile: Differentiable reacting flow modeling software
tools.detailed_description: A differentiable software package for modeling reacting flows and combustion, built in Julia, enabling gradient-based optimization and analysis of chemical kinetics.

tools.name: torchdyn

tools.detailed_description: A dedicated PyTorch library for neural ordinary differential equations (Neural ODEs), implicit models, and related numerical methods for deep learning and scientific computing.

tools.name: Num_Func
tools.one_line_profile: MATLAB numerical analysis toolbox
tools.detailed_description: A comprehensive numerical analysis toolbox for MATLAB, including modules for interpolation, fitting, numerical integration, and solving linear/nonlinear equations and ODEs.

tools.name: quadrature
tools.one_line_profile: Fast numerical integration library for Rust
tools.detailed_description: A Rust library providing fast numerical integration (quadrature) algorithms for scientific computing.

tools.name: Massively-Parallel-GPU-ODE-Solver
tools.one_line_profile: GPU accelerated integrator for large systems of ODEs
tools.detailed_description: A CUDA-based solver designed for the massively parallel integration of large numbers of independent ordinary differential equation systems.

tools.name: PinnDE

tools.name: scipy_dae

tools.name: GeometricIntegrators.jl

tools.detailed_description: A Julia library dedicated to geometric numerical integration, providing methods that preserve geometric properties of differential equations, such as symplecticity and energy conservation.

tools.detailed_description: A Julia package for performing numerical integration over complex geometry domains defined by Meshes.jl, supporting various quadrature rules.

tools.name: NumericalIntegration.jl

tools.detailed_description: A Julia library providing simple and efficient numerical integration methods (like Trapezoidal and Simpson's rules) for data that has already been sampled.

tools.name: QuadGK.jl

tools.detailed_description: A high-performance Julia library for adaptive 1D numerical integration using Gauss-Kronrod rules, capable of handling singularities and infinite intervals.

tools.name: Measurements.jl

tools.detailed_description: A Julia library for performing arithmetic and numerical operations (including integration) on numbers with uncertainties, automatically handling error propagation.

tools.name: dpm-solver

tools.detailed_description: A dedicated high-order ODE solver designed to accelerate the sampling process of diffusion probabilistic models, significantly reducing the number of steps required for generation.

tools.name: RungeKuttaCpp

tools.name: scikit-sundae

tools.detailed_description: A Python interface to the SUNDIALS suite of non-linear and differential/algebraic equation solvers, developed by NREL for scientific simulation tasks.

tools.detailed_description: A comprehensive MATLAB toolbox providing numerical solvers for rootfinding, optimization, integration, and differential equations, specifically tailored for computational economics and finance applications.

tools.name: differential-equations
tools.one_line_profile: High-performance Rust library for solving differential equations
tools.detailed_description: A Rust library designed for high-performance numerical solution of differential equations, offering various integration schemes.

tools.name: FractionalCalculus.jl

tools.detailed_description: A Julia package dedicated to comprehensive and high-precision numerical fractional calculus computing, providing support for fractional differentiation and integration operations.

tools.name: Catalyst.jl

tools.detailed_description: A domain-specific language and interface for defining chemical reaction networks and systems biology models, capable of generating high-performance O(1) solvers and GPU-parallelized simulations within the SciML ecosystem.

tools.detailed_description: A library for fusing neural networks with differential equations, enabling Neural ODEs, SDEs, DAEs, and physics-informed machine learning (PINNs) with O(1) backpropagation and GPU support.

It provides a unified interface to various solvers (including those from scipy, gsl, and sundials) and supports symbolic representation of equations.

It enables automatic differentiation (AD) around implicit solvers without propagating AD through the iterative process, suitable for optimization and sensitivity analysis.

tools.detailed_description: A simulation package that wraps high-performance ODE/DAE solvers (like SUNDIALS/IDA/CVODE) into a Python interface, supporting explicit, implicit, and DAE systems with event handling.

tools.detailed_description: A Rust crate providing standard numerical integration algorithms (e.g., Simpson's rule, Trapezoidal rule) for scientific computing applications in the Rust ecosystem.

tools.detailed_description: Provides Python bindings and a C++ interface for PartMC, a particle-resolved Monte Carlo code used in atmospheric science to simulate aerosol dynamics and chemistry.

tools.detailed_description: An OCaml library providing a suite of numerical solvers for ordinary differential equations (ODEs), designed to integrate with the Owl scientific computing ecosystem.

tools.detailed_description: A PyTorch-based library for solving imaging inverse problems (e.g., denoising, super-resolution, inpainting) using deep learning techniques.

tools.name: InverseBench
tools.one_line_profile: Benchmark suite for inverse problems
tools.detailed_description: A benchmark suite designed to evaluate and compare methods for solving inverse problems, providing standardized datasets and evaluation metrics.

tools.name: DL4TO
tools.one_line_profile: Deep learning library for 3D topology optimization
tools.detailed_description: A Python library for 3D topology optimization based on PyTorch, facilitating the integration of neural networks into the topology optimization pipeline.

tools.name: dolfin-adjoint
tools.one_line_profile: Automatic differentiation for FEniCS
tools.detailed_description: A library that automatically derives the discrete adjoint and tangent linear models from a high-level description of the forward model in FEniCS, enabling efficient gradient-based optimization and error estimation.

tools.name: casadi-on-gpu
tools.one_line_profile: GPU code generation for CasADi
tools.detailed_description: A utility to convert CasADi-generated C code into GPU-ready kernels, enabling large batches of function evaluations to run in parallel on GPUs.

tools.name: diff_uv
tools.one_line_profile: Differentiable underwater vehicle dynamics
tools.detailed_description: A library providing differentiable dynamics models for underwater vehicles, suitable for use in optimization and control tasks requiring gradient information.

tools.name: RL2Grid
tools.one_line_profile: Benchmark environment for reinforcement learning in power grid operations
tools.detailed_description: A standardized benchmark for reinforcement learning agents in realistic power grid environments, modeling real-time operations like topology optimization and redispatching with full AC power flow simulation.

tools.name: ERT
tools.one_line_profile: Ensemble-based tool for reservoir modeling and data assimilation
tools.detailed_description: A tool designed for running ensembles of dynamical models (e.g., reservoir models) to perform sensitivity analysis and data assimilation using methods like Ensemble Smoother (ES) and ES-MDA.

tools.name: Iterative Ensemble Smoother
tools.one_line_profile: Algorithms for data assimilation using ensemble methods
tools.detailed_description: A library providing implementations of iterative ensemble smoother algorithms for data assimilation tasks, developed by Equinor.

tools.name: Angler
tools.one_line_profile: Frequency-domain photonic simulation and inverse design optimization
tools.detailed_description: A library for frequency-domain photonic simulation and inverse design optimization, supporting linear and nonlinear devices.

tools.name: Sobol Attribution Method
tools.one_line_profile: Efficient Sobol-based sensitivity analysis for black-box models
tools.detailed_description: An implementation of the Sobol Attribution Method for efficient black-box explanations and sensitivity analysis, focusing on variance-based attribution.

tools.name: TROPIC
tools.one_line_profile: Trajectory Optimization framework based on CasADi
tools.detailed_description: A library for trajectory optimization implemented in CasADi, facilitating the formulation and solution of optimal control problems.

tools.name: BayesBay
tools.one_line_profile: Generalised Bayesian inversion framework
tools.detailed_description: A Python library for performing generalised Bayesian inversion, allowing for flexible definition of inverse problems and trans-dimensional sampling.

tools.name: OccamyPy
tools.one_line_profile: Library for solving large-scale inverse problems
tools.detailed_description: A Python library designed for solving large-scale inverse problems, providing operators and solvers for geophysical and general scientific applications.

tools.name: SDA
tools.one_line_profile: Score-based Data Assimilation implementation
tools.detailed_description: Implementation of Score-based Data Assimilation, leveraging score-based generative models for solving data assimilation problems.

tools.name: ILO
tools.one_line_profile: Intermediate Layer Optimization for Inverse Problems using Deep Generative Models
tools.detailed_description: Implementation of Intermediate Layer Optimization (ILO), a method for solving inverse problems (like inpainting, denoising) by optimizing in the latent space of deep generative models.

tools.name: pyGIMLi
tools.one_line_profile: Geophysical Inversion and Modeling Library
tools.detailed_description: An open-source library for modeling and inversion in geophysics, supporting various methods like ERT, refraction seismics, and structural coupling.

tools.name: closed-chain-ik-js
tools.one_line_profile: Generalized inverse kinematics solver for parallel kinematics systems
tools.detailed_description: A JavaScript library for solving inverse kinematics problems, supporting closed chains, dynamic reconfiguration, and arbitrary joint configurations using damped least squares error minimization.

tools.name: ceviche-challenges
tools.one_line_profile: Photonic inverse design challenge problems
tools.detailed_description: A suite of benchmark problems for photonic inverse design and topology optimization, providing standard environments for testing optimization algorithms.

tools.name: Fabrik2DArduino
tools.one_line_profile: Inverse kinematics solver for Arduino
tools.detailed_description: A fast forward and inverse kinematics solver for Arduino based on the FABRIK algorithm, supporting up to 4 degrees of freedom for robotic control.

tools.name: TopoOpt
tools.one_line_profile: Network topology optimization for distributed DNN training
tools.detailed_description: A tool for optimizing network topology to accelerate distributed Deep Neural Network training, applying optimization techniques to system infrastructure.

tools.name: hIPPYlib
tools.one_line_profile: Framework for large-scale inverse problems
tools.detailed_description: An extensible software framework for solving large-scale deterministic and Bayesian inverse problems, providing tools for adjoints, Hessian actions, and uncertainty quantification.

tools.name: MoDL
tools.one_line_profile: Model-Based Deep Learning Architecture for Inverse Problems
tools.detailed_description: Implementation of MoDL, a model-based deep learning architecture for solving inverse problems such as MRI reconstruction, combining physics-based models with learned priors.

tools.name: savvy
tools.one_line_profile: Visualization tool for high-dimensional sensitivity analysis
tools.detailed_description: A tool designed to visualize and explore high-dimensional sensitivity analysis data, aiding in the interpretation of complex model dependencies.

tools.name: CDDB
tools.one_line_profile: Direct Diffusion Bridge for Inverse Problems
tools.detailed_description: PyTorch implementation of Direct Diffusion Bridge using Data Consistency, a method for solving inverse problems using diffusion models.

tools.name: DDS
tools.one_line_profile: Decomposed Diffusion Sampling for Inverse Problems
tools.detailed_description: Implementation of Decomposed Diffusion Sampling (DDS) for accelerating large-scale inverse problems using diffusion models.

tools.name: DiffusionMBIR
tools.one_line_profile: 3D Inverse Problems solver using 2D Diffusion Models
tools.detailed_description: A framework for solving 3D inverse problems (like medical imaging) using pre-trained 2D diffusion models as priors.

tools.name: MCG_diffusion

tools.detailed_description: Implementation of Manifold Constrained Gradients (MCG) to improve diffusion models for solving inverse problems.

tools.detailed_description: A Julia wrapper for the CasADi software framework, enabling numerical optimization and optimal control within the Julia ecosystem.

tools.name: isopod

tools.detailed_description: A MOOSE-based application developed at Idaho National Laboratory for solving multiphysics PDE-constrained optimization problems.

tools.name: invrs-gym

tools.detailed_description: A gym-like environment and collection of challenge problems for benchmarking inverse design algorithms in photonics and other fields.

tools.name: SimpleMC

tools.detailed_description: A simplified Markov Chain Monte Carlo (MCMC) code designed for cosmological parameter estimation, focusing on expansion history.

tools.name: bayes-drt

tools.detailed_description: A Python package for hierarchical Bayesian inversion of electrochemical impedance spectroscopy (EIS) data to distribution of relaxation times (DRT).

tools.name: BayHunter

tools.detailed_description: A tool for transdimensional Bayesian inversion of surface wave dispersion and receiver functions using Markov Chain Monte Carlo methods.

tools.name: PyTopo3D

tools.detailed_description: A Python framework for 3D topology optimization using the SIMP (Solid Isotropic Material with Penalization) method.

tools.name: FISTA-Net

tools.detailed_description: Implementation of FISTA-Net, a model-based deep learning network designed to solve inverse problems in imaging by unrolling the FISTA algorithm.

tools.name: robust-nets
tools.one_line_profile: Deep neural network framework for solving inverse problems with robustness guarantees
tools.detailed_description: Implementation of a deep learning approach for solving inverse problems, focusing on robustness against adversarial attacks and noise, as presented in the associated research paper.

tools.name: torch_ACA
tools.one_line_profile: Adaptive Checkpoint Adjoint method for gradient estimation in Neural ODEs
tools.detailed_description: A PyTorch library implementing the Adaptive Checkpoint Adjoint (ACA) method, designed to improve gradient estimation accuracy and memory efficiency in Neural Ordinary Differential Equations (Neural ODEs).

tools.name: openap-top

tools.detailed_description: A Python package for calculating optimal flight trajectories based on aircraft performance models, useful for aviation research and trajectory optimization.

tools.name: franka_panda_description

tools.detailed_description: A robotics simulation package containing accurate URDF descriptions and dynamics parameters for the Franka Emika Panda robot, essential for physics-based simulation and control research in Gazebo.

tools.name: ADCME.jl

tools.detailed_description: A Julia library leveraging TensorFlow for automatic differentiation, specifically designed for inverse modeling, physics-informed machine learning, and PDE-constrained optimization in computational engineering.

tools.detailed_description: A solver for 3D human body estimation that uses a pseudo-linear inverse kinematics approach to recover body pose parameters from observations.

tools.detailed_description: A C++ library providing algorithms for solving inverse kinematics problems in robotics, enabling the calculation of joint configurations for desired end-effector poses.

tools.detailed_description: A MATLAB-based program for 3D topology optimization, providing an efficient solver for structural design problems to minimize compliance under volume constraints.

tools.detailed_description: A Python implementation of an iterative solution to Tikhonov regularization (ridge regression) for solving ill-posed linear inverse problems with singular or ill-conditioned data matrices.

tools.detailed_description: A simple and lightweight Python library for calculating inverse kinematics, suitable for basic robotic arm simulation and kinematic analysis.

tools.name: rlssm

tools.detailed_description: A Python library for Bayesian parameter estimation of reinforcement learning (RL) and sequential sampling models (SSM), utilizing PyStan for inference in cognitive modeling.

tools.detailed_description: An optimized, open-source GPU-accelerated solver designed for handling large-scale inverse homogenization problems in material science and mechanics.

tools.name: EstimationPy

tools.detailed_description: A Python package for performing state and parameter estimation, likely designed for use with Modelica-based building energy or physical system models (developed by LBL-SRG).

tools.detailed_description: A collection of Python scripts and tools to facilitate running the Weather Research and Forecasting (WRF) model coupled with the Data Assimilation Research Testbed (DART) system.

tools.detailed_description: A Julia package implementing various global sensitivity analysis methods (e.g., Sobol, Morris) to assess how uncertainty in model output can be apportioned to uncertainty in inputs.

tools.name: gPINN
tools.one_line_profile: Gradient-enhanced physics-informed neural networks for forward and inverse PDE problems
tools.detailed_description: A Python library implementing Gradient-enhanced Physics-Informed Neural Networks (gPINNs). It improves the accuracy and training efficiency of standard PINNs by incorporating gradient information of the PDE residual into the loss function, suitable for solving both forward and inverse partial differential equation problems.

tools.name: wb-mpc-locoman

It leverages Pinocchio for rigid body dynamics and CasADi for algorithmic differentiation and optimal control, supporting multiple dynamics formulations and solver backends for model predictive control (MPC).

tools.name: casclik
tools.one_line_profile: Closed-loop inverse kinematics (CLIK) solver based on CasADi
tools.detailed_description: A Python library for solving Closed-Loop Inverse Kinematics (CLIK) problems using CasADi. It provides a framework for defining and solving inverse kinematics optimization problems for robotic manipulators, leveraging CasADi's symbolic framework for efficient gradient computation.

tools.name: urdf2casadi

tools.detailed_description: A library that converts URDF (Unified Robot Description Format) chain descriptions into CasADi symbolic functions. This enables the generation of efficient forward kinematics and Jacobian functions for use in optimization-based control and motion planning.

tools.name: BOPINN

tools.name: KalmanFilter Sanctuary

tools.name: EP-PINNs

tools.name: bayes-hier

tools.detailed_description: A MATLAB toolbox implementing Markov Chain Monte Carlo (MCMC) methods for solving Bayesian hierarchical inverse problems. It is designed to handle uncertainty quantification in inverse modeling contexts.

tools.detailed_description: A Python implementation of deep learning architectures inspired by Approximate Message Passing (AMP) algorithms. It is designed to solve sparse linear inverse problems, offering a structured approach to learning inverse mappings from data.

tools.name: jams_fortran

tools.name: nlgreyfast

tools.name: MplusAutomation

tools.detailed_description: An R package that automates the estimation and interpretation of latent variable models using Mplus. It allows for batch processing, model generation, and extraction of fit statistics and parameters, streamlining the workflow for structural equation modeling and related statistical analyses.

tools.name: EMTO
tools.one_line_profile: Efficient Multiscale Topology Optimization

tools.detailed_description: A Python package built on CasADi that provides algorithms for solving Mixed-Integer Nonlinear Programs (MINLPs). It is useful for optimization problems involving both discrete and continuous variables in scientific and engineering contexts.

tools.name: fenitop

tools.name: Appa

tools.name: TopOp

tools.name: kuka_iiwa_ik

tools.name: pdeoptim

tools.detailed_description: A MATLAB solver for nonlinear PDE-constrained optimization problems using a spectral-in-time Newton-Krylov method. Developed by the Numerical Linear Algebra Group, it addresses time-dependent control problems.

tools.name: topopt-mgcg-matlab

tools.detailed_description: MATLAB codes for efficient 3-D topology optimization utilizing multigrid Preconditioned Conjugate Gradient (PCG) methods and approximate sensitivity analysis.

tools.name: topopt-stress-inexact-sensitivities

tools.name: LETO

tools.detailed_description: Parameter estimation routines for logistic Item Characteristic Curves (ICC) within the framework of Item Response Theory (IRT), used in psychometrics and educational testing.

tools.name: AnDA

tools.name: LaVEnDAR

tools.name: DARTS

tools.name: ttrecipes

tools.name: TOBS

tools.name: paragami

It integrates physical laws into the deep learning training process to improve generalization and physical consistency.

tools.detailed_description: torchcde provides differentiable solvers for Controlled Differential Equations (CDEs) in PyTorch, enabling the processing of irregular time series data. It features GPU support and memory-efficient adjoint backpropagation.

tools.name: autodiff (Go)

tools.name: Numdifftools

tools.detailed_description: A Python library that solves automatic numerical differentiation problems in one or more variables. It provides tools to compute gradients, Hessians, and Jacobians using finite difference methods when analytical derivatives are unavailable.

tools.name: PDEBench

tools.detailed_description: PDEBench is a comprehensive benchmark framework for Scientific Machine Learning (SciML), providing diverse PDE datasets and evaluation metrics to test and compare different machine learning models for physics simulation.

tools.name: AeroSandbox

tools.detailed_description: AeroSandbox is a Python package for aircraft design optimization that leverages automatic differentiation for fast gradient-based optimization. It includes composable analysis tools for aerodynamics, propulsion, structures, and trajectory design.

tools.name: NeuralFoil

tools.name: Neuromancer

tools.name: VMAS

tools.detailed_description: A benchmarking framework designed to evaluate and compare the performance of various solvers for bi-level optimization problems.

tools.detailed_description: A flexible DGEMM (Double-Precision General Matrix Multiplication) library for GPUs (OpenCL, CUDA, CAL) specifically optimized to support High Performance Linpack (HPL) benchmarks.

tools.detailed_description: A comprehensive benchmark suite for assessing Large Language Models' proficiency in analyzing scientific literature across various fields, focusing on memorization, comprehension, and analysis capabilities.

tools.name: CalibrationErrors.jl

tools.detailed_description: A Julia library providing methods for estimating calibration errors, which is essential for verifying the reliability of probabilistic predictions in scientific modeling and machine learning.

tools.detailed_description: A benchmark suite designed to evaluate active learning strategies for Neural PDE solvers, facilitating the comparison of different learning algorithms in the context of physical simulations.

tools.detailed_description: A benchmark suite for evaluating Large Planning Models (LPMs) on Human-Robot Collaboration and Robot Instruction Following tasks within the Habitat simulator.

tools.detailed_description: A benchmarking tool designed to evaluate the performance of Physics-Informed Neural Networks (PINNs) across various hardware architectures, specifically focusing on solving wave equations.

tools.name: FpDebug

tools.detailed_description: A dynamic program analysis tool based on Valgrind designed to detect and diagnose floating-point accuracy issues in numerical software.

tools.name: amplify-benchmark

tools.detailed_description: A framework for benchmarking quantum annealing machines, Ising machines, and mathematical optimization solvers, facilitating performance comparison of next-generation computing hardware.

tools.detailed_description: A C++ library that facilitates the use of hardware accelerators (via OpenCL) for high-performance computing, providing a programming model for heterogeneous scientific applications.

tools.detailed_description: A configuration and workflow system that leverages Continuous Integration (CI) services to automatically re-run scientific analyses, ensuring computational reproducibility and verifiable results.

tools.name: DLIO Benchmark

tools.detailed_description: A benchmark suite designed to represent the I/O patterns of modern scientific deep learning applications, used for profiling and optimizing storage performance in HPC environments.

tools.name: JEEBench

tools.detailed_description: A dataset and evaluation framework containing challenging Physics, Chemistry, and Mathematics problems from the JEE exam, used to benchmark the scientific problem-solving capabilities of Large Language Models.

tools.name: h5bench

tools.detailed_description: A suite of benchmarks specifically designed to measure HDF5 I/O performance under various patterns typical of scientific applications.

tools.name: FPChecker

tools.detailed_description: FPChecker is a dynamic analysis tool developed by LLNL to detect floating-point errors in High-Performance Computing (HPC) applications. It instruments code to monitor floating-point operations at runtime, identifying issues such as underflow, overflow, and loss of precision, which are critical for the numerical verification of scientific simulations.

tools.name: MASA
tools.one_line_profile: Library for Method of Manufactured Solutions (MMS) verification

It provides a repository of manufactured solutions for various physics equations, allowing developers to verify the order of accuracy and correctness of their PDE solvers.

tools.name: rust-herbie-lint

tools.detailed_description: A Rust compiler plugin that integrates with Herbie to automatically check for numerical instability in floating-point expressions during compilation. It serves as a static analysis tool specifically for numerical verification, helping developers identify unstable mathematical operations in scientific code.

tools.name: mcalib
tools.one_line_profile: Automated rounding error analysis tool for floating-point software using Monte Carlo methods
tools.detailed_description: The Monte Carlo Arithmetic Library (MCALIB) is a tool designed to perform automated rounding error analysis on floating-point software. It utilizes Monte Carlo simulation techniques to estimate the precision and stability of numerical computations, aiding in the verification of numerical software.

tools.name: HerbiePlugin

tools.detailed_description: A Glasgow Haskell Compiler (GHC) plugin that integrates with Herbie to automatically rewrite Haskell floating-point expressions for improved numerical stability. It helps developers detect and fix floating-point inaccuracies during compilation.

tools.name: mlbench-old

tools.detailed_description: A C++ library dedicated to verified numerical computations. It implements interval arithmetic and other methods to ensure the accuracy and reliability of numerical results, suitable for rigorous scientific computing tasks.

tools.detailed_description: A benchmark designed to evaluate AI models on scientific reasoning and information extraction tasks. It focuses on extracting relationships between datasets, methods, and metrics from full-text scientific documents.

tools.detailed_description: A tool to run shell commands with features for scientific reproducibility and robustness. It likely handles logging, environment capture, or execution tracking to ensure computational experiments are reproducible.

tools.name: ControlGym

tools.detailed_description: A MATLAB implementation of the Error-State Kalman Filter (ESKF) algorithm specifically designed for attitude estimation. It serves as a numerical solver and reference implementation for robust state estimation in navigation and robotics.
